attributes.comment:
I have just recently received approval for my I-600A advanced process orphan
petition. However, due to the long referral wait time with China, I am sure I will
need to re-file with CIS. Adoption is expensive enough without having to re-do
paperwork with costly fees, let alone having to re-file at higher rates. Will my
fingerprints change over the next 12 months? I don't see how that is possible.
Why can't the existing prints just be run through the database again? This whole
process is exhausting and seems filled with inefficiencies. Not to mention that it is
impossible to get any information from CIS - once the paperwork is filed it enters
an abyss and then one day a little envelope comes in the mail. Do you know how
unsettling and upsetting it is to not have any control or information during this
rather lengthy processing? What other agency can get away with saying "don't
call us and we certainly won't call you." I was lucky enough to have my
congressman's office make periodic inquiries to keep us updated, but most people
don't have that luxury. Why do we make it so hard for people to do something
good? I'm sure more people would adopt if it wasn't for the cost and this daunting
paperwork process. If you must raise the rates then please consider some sort of
discount rate for people who've had their paperwork expire due to long referral
times, or please consider extending the period of time the visa and fingerprints are
valid.
Thank you.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Christine McClean
